channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Exposure-slot: Exposure-centric representations learning with Slot-in-Slot Attention for Region-aware Exposure Correction
item.description: Image exposure correction enhances images captured under diverse real-world conditions by addressing issues of under- and over-exposure, which can result in the loss of critical details and hinder content recognition.

item.title: Bridging the Gap Between Open-Source and Proprietary LLMs in Table QA
item.description: This paper presents a system developed for SemEval 2025 Task 8: Question Answering (QA) over tabular data.

item.title: What is the Cost of Differential Privacy for Deep Learning-Based Trajectory Generation?
item.description: In conclusion, DP trajectory generation remains a challenging task, and formal guarantees are currently only feasible with large datasets and in constrained use cases.

item.title: Revisit What You See: Disclose Language Prior in Vision Tokens for Efficient Guided Decoding of LVLMs
item.description: Our approach leverages the semantic information embedded within vision tokens by projecting them into the text token distribution space, and dynamically selecting the most relevant vision token at each decoding step through constrained divergence minimization.

item.title: Data-Driven Modeling of IRCU Patient Flow in the COVID-19 Pandemic
item.description: This study evaluated clinical outcomes and operational dynamics of a new Spanish IRCU with specialized staffing.

item.title: 3D-Aware Vision-Language Models Fine-Tuning with Geometric Distillation
item.description: Vision-Language Models (VLMs) have shown remarkable performance on diverse visual and linguistic tasks, yet they remain fundamentally limited in their understanding of 3D spatial structures.

item.title: AtmosMJ: Revisiting Gating Mechanism for AI Weather Forecasting Beyond the Year Scale
item.description: This has led to the prevailing assumption that such representations are necessary to enforce physical consistency and long-term stability.

item.title: TACTIC: Translation Agents with Cognitive-Theoretic Interactive Collaboration
item.description: Using DeepSeek-V3 as the base model, TACTIC surpasses GPT-4. 1 by an average of +0. 6 XCOMET and +1. 18 COMETKIWI-23.

item.title: DiscoVLA: Discrepancy Reduction in Vision, Language, and Alignment for Parameter-Efficient Video-Text Retrieval
item.description: The parameter-efficient adaptation of the image-text pretraining model CLIP for video-text retrieval is a prominent area of research.

item.title: Identifying Hubs Through Influential Nodes in Transportation Network by Using a Gravity Centrality Approach
item.description: Hubs are strategic locations that function as central nodes within clusters of cities, playing a pivotal role in the distribution of goods, services, and connectivity.

item.title: Diversity-Guided MLP Reduction for Efficient Large Vision Transformers
item.description: To this end, we focus on the recoverability of the compressed models and propose a Diversity-Guided MLP Reduction (DGMR) method to significantly reduce the parameters of large vision transformers with only negligible performance degradation.

item.title: Adapting Vision-Language Foundation Model for Next Generation Medical Ultrasound Image Analysis
item.description: Medical ultrasonography is an essential imaging technique for examining superficial organs and tissues, including lymph nodes, breast, and thyroid.

item.title: Well Begun is Half Done: Low-resource Preference Alignment by Weak-to-Strong Decoding
item.description: Motivated by the observation that the difficulty of generating aligned responses is concentrated at the beginning of decoding, we propose a novel framework, Weak-to-Strong Decoding (WSD), to enhance the alignment ability of base models by the guidance of a small aligned model.

item.title: Multiple Object Stitching for Unsupervised Representation Learning
item.description: Contrastive learning for single object centric images has achieved remarkable progress on unsupervised representation, but suffering inferior performance on the widespread images with multiple objects.

item.title: MiniCPM4: Ultra-Efficient LLMs on End Devices
item.description: Specifically, in terms of model architecture, we propose InfLLM v2, a trainable sparse attention mechanism that accelerates both prefilling and decoding phases for long-context processing.

item.title: Open World Scene Graph Generation using Vision Language Models
item.description: Scene-Graph Generation (SGG) seeks to recognize objects in an image and distill their salient pairwise relationships.

item.title: CausalPFN: Amortized Causal Effect Estimation via In-Context Learning
item.description: CausalPFN combines ideas from Bayesian causal inference with the large-scale training protocol of prior-fitted networks (PFNs), learning to map raw observations directly to causal effects without any task-specific adjustment.

item.title: A Two-Phase Deep Learning Framework for Adaptive Time-Stepping in High-Speed Flow Modeling
item.description: Here, we propose a two-phase machine learning method, known as ShockCast, to model high-speed flows with adaptive time-stepping.

item.title: Flowing Datasets with Wasserstein over Wasserstein Gradient Flows
item.description: Many applications in machine learning involve data represented as probability distributions.

item.title: FreeGave: 3D Physics Learning from Dynamic Videos by Gaussian Velocity
item.description: In this paper, we aim to model 3D scene geometry, appearance, and the underlying physics purely from multi-view videos.

item.title: Eliciting Fine-Tuned Transformer Capabilities via Inference-Time Techniques
item.description: Grounded in the Turing completeness of transformers, these results provide a theoretical foundation for resource-efficient deployment of large language models, with practical techniques like retrieval-augmented generation bridging theory to real-world applications.

item.title: Discrete and Continuous Difference of Submodular Minimization
item.description: For discrete domains, we observe that DS minimization is equivalent to minimizing the difference of two convex (DC) functions, as in the set function case.

item.title: DLNet: Direction-Aware Feature Integration for Robust Lane Detection in Complex Environments
item.description: The rapid advancement of autonomous driving systems has created a pressing need for accurate and robust lane detection to ensure driving safety and reliability.

item.title: Learning Compact Vision Tokens for Efficient Large Multimodal Models
item.description: Specifically, we propose a Spatial Token Fusion (STF) method to learn compact vision tokens for short vision token sequence, where spatial-adjacent tokens are fused into one.

item.title: The influence of cell phenotype on collective cell invasion into the extracellular matrix
item.description: Understanding the interactions between cells and the extracellular matrix (ECM) during collective cell invasion is crucial for advancements in tissue engineering, cancer therapies, and regenerative medicine.

item.title: The Currents of Conflict: Decomposing Conflict Trends with Gaussian Processes
item.description: I present a novel approach to estimating the temporal and spatial patterns of violent conflict.

item.title: Unleashing the Potential of Consistency Learning for Detecting and Grounding Multi-Modal Media Manipulation
item.description: To tackle the threat of fake news, the task of detecting and grounding multi-modal media manipulation DGM4 has received increasing attention.

item.title: SDS-Net: Shallow-Deep Synergism-detection Network for infrared small target detection
item.description: Current CNN-based infrared small target detection (IRSTD) methods generally overlook the heterogeneity between shallow and deep features, leading to inefficient collaboration between shallow fine-grained structural information and deep high-level semantic representations.

item.title: Eigenspectrum Analysis of Neural Networks without Aspect Ratio Bias
item.description: We validate our approach across various optimization techniques and application domains that involve eigenspectrum analysis of weights, including image classification in computer vision (CV) models, scientific machine learning (SciML) model training, and large language model (LLM) pruning.

item.title: TissUnet: Improved Extracranial Tissue and Cranium Segmentation for Children through Adulthood
item.description: In a second validation using expert manual annotations, median Dice was 0. 83 [IQR: 0. 83-0. 84] in healthy individuals and 0. 81 [IQR: 0. 78-0. 83] in tumor cases, outperforming previous state-of-the-art method.

item.title: Edge-Enabled Collaborative Object Detection for Real-Time Multi-Vehicle Perception
item.description: To address these challenges, we introduce an innovative framework, Edge-Enabled Collaborative Object Detection (ECOD) for CAVs, that leverages edge computing and multi-CAV collaboration for real-time, multi-perspective object detection.

item.title: Inference economics of language models
item.description: We develop a theoretical model that addresses the economic trade-off between cost per token versus serial token generation speed when deploying LLMs for inference at scale.

item.title: Tight analyses of first-order methods with error feedback
item.description: Communication between agents often constitutes a major computational bottleneck in distributed learning.

item.title: EMBER2024 -- A Benchmark Dataset for Holistic Evaluation of Malware Classifiers
item.description: A lack of accessible data has historically restricted malware analysis research, and practitioners have relied heavily on datasets provided by industry sources to advance.

item.title: OGGSplat: Open Gaussian Growing for Generalizable Reconstruction with Expanded Field-of-View
item.description: To evaluate our method, we establish a Gaussian Outpainting (GO) benchmark that assesses both semantic and generative quality of reconstructed open-vocabulary scenes.

item.title: Exp4Fuse: A Rank Fusion Framework for Enhanced Sparse Retrieval using Large Language Model-based Query Expansion
item.description: However, the efficacy of this method is highly dependent on the quality of the generated documents, which often requires complex prompt strategies and the integration of advanced dense retrieval techniques.

item.title: Progressive Tempering Sampler with Diffusion
item.description: We also introduce a novel method to combine high-temperature diffusion models to generate approximate lower-temperature samples, which are minimally refined using MCMC and used to train the next diffusion model.

item.title: Time to Talk: LLM Agents for Asynchronous Group Communication in Mafia Games
item.description: For example, in group chats, online team meetings, or social games, there is no inherent notion of turns; therefore, the decision of when to speak forms a crucial part of the participant's decision making.

item.title: AliTok: Towards Sequence Modeling Alignment between Tokenizer and Autoregressive Model
item.description: Autoregressive image generation aims to predict the next token based on previous ones.

item.title: LLMs for sensory-motor control: Combining in-context and iterative learning
item.description: We propose a method that enables large language models (LLMs) to control embodied agents by directly mapping continuous observation vectors to continuous action vectors.

item.title: Dissecting Logical Reasoning in LLMs: A Fine-Grained Evaluation and Supervision Study
item.description: Logical reasoning is a core capability for many applications of large language models (LLMs), yet existing benchmarks often rely solely on final-answer accuracy, failing to capture the quality and structure of the reasoning process.

item.title: MMSU: A Massive Multi-task Spoken Language Understanding and Reasoning Benchmark
item.description: To address this gap, we introduce MMSU, a comprehensive benchmark designed specifically for understanding and reasoning in spoken language.

item.title: Agentic AI for Intent-Based Industrial Automation
item.description: The recent development of Agentic AI systems, empowered by autonomous large language models (LLMs) agents with planning and tool-usage capabilities, enables new possibilities for the evolution of industrial automation and reduces the complexity introduced by Industry 4. 0.

item.title: GOLFer: Smaller LM-Generated Documents Hallucination Filter & Combiner for Query Expansion in Information Retrieval
item.description: Large language models (LLMs)-based query expansion for information retrieval augments queries with generated hypothetical documents with LLMs.

item.title: From Play to Replay: Composed Video Retrieval for Temporally Fine-Grained Videos
item.description: Composed Video Retrieval (CoVR) retrieves a target video given a query video and a modification text describing the intended change.

item.title: Truth in the Few: High-Value Data Selection for Efficient Multi-Modal Reasoning
item.description: While multi-modal large language models (MLLMs) have made significant progress in complex reasoning tasks via reinforcement learning, it is commonly believed that extensive training data is necessary for improving multi-modal reasoning ability, inevitably leading to data redundancy and substantial computational costs.

item.title: FlashDMoE: Fast Distributed MoE in a Single Kernel
item.description: The computational sparsity of Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) models enables sub-linear growth in compute cost as model size increases, thus offering a scalable path to training massive neural networks.

item.title: Unifying Appearance Codes and Bilateral Grids for Driving Scene Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel multi-scale bilateral grid that unifies appearance codes and bilateral grids.

item.title: Intelligent Channel Allocation for IEEE 802.11be Multi-Link Operation: When MAB Meets LLM
item.description: To further reduce sample complexity and enhance generalizability across diverse network scenarios, we put forth LLM-BAI-MCTS, an intelligent algorithm for the dynamic channel allocation problem by integrating the Large Language Model (LLM) into the BAI-MCTS algorithm.

item.title: User Altruism in Recommendation Systems
item.description: We compare the users' social welfare under truthful preference reporting and under a class of strategies capturing user altruism.
